attributes.title: Sexy Animals and The Science of Attraction - #1
attributes.caption: The real reason you find another human sexy.
attributes.description: What do pale people and peacocks have in common sexually? And, Why do elephants have toe nails? Gus Sorola challenges Chris Demarais and evolutionary biologist Sally Le Page with some of the quirkiest science questions submitted by viewers. Brought to you by Blue Apron Sally's Channel -
attributes.display_title: Sexy Animals and The Science of Attraction - #1

attributes.title: Planet of the Apes Isn't Fiction - #2
attributes.caption: The mindblowing skills animals are teaching each other.
attributes.description: Can animals teach their offspring a language? And what other amazing things are animals picking up from humans? Gus Sorola challenges Chris Demarais and evolutionary biologist Sally Le Page with some of the quirkiest science questions submitted by viewers. Brought to you by Blue Apron
attributes.display_title: Planet of the Apes Isn't Fiction - #2

attributes.title: Life According to a Fly - #3
attributes.caption: Only Chris can connect the dots between one of Amercia's greatest disasters and a tiny fly.
attributes.description: Do flies see life in slow motion? and, How do animals tell time? Gus Sorola challenges Chris Demarais and evolutionary biologist Sally Le Page with some of the quirkiest science questions submitted by viewers. Brought to you by MVMT Watches

attributes.title: Why Your Body Jerks When Falling Asleep - #4
attributes.caption: Why your body thinks it is falling when going to sleep.
attributes.description: Why does your body jerk when you're just about to fall asleep? And the beetle that shoots it's enemies with acid from its butt. How does it not blow its own legs off? Gus Sorola challenges Chris Demarais and evolutionary biologist Sally Le Page with some of the quirkiest science questions submitted by viewers. Brought to you by Blue Apron
attributes.display_title: Why Your Body Jerks When Falling Asleep - #4

attributes.title: The Second Brain in Your Body - #5
attributes.caption: Gus Sorola challenges Chris Demarais and evolutionary biologist Sally Le Page with some of the quirkiest science questions submitted by viewers. Brought to you by MVMT Watches ( http://bit.ly/2lt7XkF )

attributes.title: Human Mad Cow Disease - #6
attributes.caption: Chris asks, "What would happen if you eat a human brain?"
attributes.description: The wild effects of eating brains, "Why is terminal velocity a thing?" and more. Gus Sorola challenges Chris Demarais and evolutionary biologist Sally Le Page with some of the quirkiest science questions submitted by viewers. Brought to you by Blue Apron Sally Le Page's YouTube Channel

attributes.title: Does Shaving Really Make Your Hair Grow Faster? - #7
attributes.caption: Chris asks about hairy legs, shaving and dog poop.
attributes.description: Why is hair darker after you shave it? Can you train grass? And, How do dogs choose where to poop? Gus Sorola challenges Chris Demarais and evolutionary biologist Sally Le Page with some of the quirkiest science questions submitted by viewers. Brought to you by MVMT Watches
attributes.display_title: Does Shaving Really Make Your Hair Grow Faster? - #7

attributes.title: Spicy Food Euphoria and Animal Accents - #8
attributes.caption: Why do we enjoy the pain of spicey foods?  And cows that moo in different languages.
attributes.description: People have accents, do animals? And, why do we enjoy the pain of spicy foods? Gus Sorola challenges Chris Demarais and evolutionary biologist Sally Le Page with some of the quirkiest science questions submitted by viewers. Brought to you by Blue Apron
attributes.display_title: Spicy Food Euphoria and Animal Accents - #8

attributes.title: Outer Space Does Your Body Bad -  #9
attributes.caption: What could living on Mars do to a human's body? And the clever way birds sit on electric lines.

attributes.title: Crazy Cat Ladies - #11
attributes.caption: Do cats love humans? And, parasites that affect animal behavior.

attributes.title: Reproductive Systems, Who does it best? Humans or Animals? - #12
attributes.caption: Any advantages to having a period vs what other Animals do? And, are there any animals that can resist tooth decay?
